name: Leapwork
author: Leapwork
instanceNameFormat: Run Leapwork schedules and get results in JUnit format

inputs.name: leapworkHostname
inputs.label: Hostname
inputs.helpMarkDown: Leapwork controller hostname or IP address

inputs.name: leapworkTimeDelay
inputs.label: Time Delay (in sec)
inputs.helpMarkDown: During this time,the plugin is going to wait before it tries to get schedule state. If schedule is still running, plugin will wait again. By default this value is 3 seconds. It is strongly recommended not to use less value, because if plugin tries to get schedule state and the controller has not created it yet, controller will return 500 error code and your schedule will become Invalid for the plugin.

inputs.name: leapworkDoneStatusAs
inputs.label: Done status
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose how plugin should interprete Done-status: as Failed or as Success

inputs.name: leapworkReport
inputs.label: Report file path and name
inputs.helpMarkDown: JUnit report file. The same name and path must be entered to the JUnit report publisher

inputs.name: leapworkSchids
inputs.label: Schedule Ids
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter here leapwork Schedule Ids. Every id must be entered from a new line. Using id is more reliable, because schedule title can be changed
